abstract: An action that opens the requested window in place of the window the action is called from.
overview:
## Overview

The scene this action is called from will be backgrounded. The requested scene will be center-aligned with the backgrounded scene. The requested scene will have a default size that matches the size of the backgrounded scene. Closing the requested window will result in the backgrounded scene reappearing.

Call [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/dismissWindow] from the pushed window to dismiss the pushed window and show the backgrounded window.

Calling this action from a pushed window is not allowed.

Use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/pushWindow] environment value to get the instance of this structure for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to push a window. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/PushWindowAction/callAsFunction(id:)] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

For example, you can define a button that pushes a video preview from an editor window:

You indicate which scene to push by providing one of the following:

Use the first option to target either a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/WindowGroup] or a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Window] scene in your app that has a matching identifier. For a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/WindowGroup], the system creates a new window for the group. If the window group presents data, the system provides the default value or `nil` to the window’s root view. If the targeted scene is a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Window], the system orders it to the front.

Use the other two options to target a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/WindowGroup] and provide a value to present. If the interface already has a window from the group that is presenting the specified value, the system brings the window to the front. Otherwise, the system creates a new window and passes a binding to the specified value.

items.description: Pushes a window that is associated with the specified identifier.
items.name: callAsFunction(id:)

items.description: Pushes a window defined by the window group that presents the specified value type and that is associated with the specified identifier.
items.name: callAsFunction(id:value:)

items.description: Pushes a window defined by a window group that presents the type of the specified value.
items.name: callAsFunction(value:)

items.description: Open and close the scenes that make up your app’s interface.
items.name: Presenting windows and spaces

items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the current platform supports opening multiple windows.
items.name: supportsMultipleWindows

items.description: A window presentation action stored in a view’s environment.
items.name: openWindow

items.description: An action that presents a window.
items.name: OpenWindowAction

title: PushWindowAction
